head.p: to:americanfriend@gmx.com from:johnsm@gmx.de RE: racial differences are still so present and cruel in the USA?

p.s: I am currently reading the novel The Hate U Give in my englishEnglish class at school.
So I was searching around the Internetinternet, trying to find out, if racism is still a big problem problem in the USA, as it is described in the novel.
After some time I found this Articlearticle and I really can not belive it.
The title of the article is Black people in the USA: the racism is measurable.
It's written by Alexandra Endres and was published on Zeit online, a germanGerman buisnessbusiness mainly for news, the 25th August 2014.
There are still racial differences, because black people stay deprived, even 50 years after the seperationseparation of races officially ended, the titeltitle sentence says.
The article starts with telling the reader that aan 18 year old boy, who was Afro-American, got shot by a police officer in Ferguson two weeks before the article aired.
So you can still feel the seperationseparation in society, but not only in Ferguson.
The article gives examples for disadventageddisadvantaged black people, in form of statistics from the USA.
The author names the higher rate of black men get in a police control, through stop and frisk, more often.

He says that even 50 years after the congress under the president Lynden B. JonsonLyndon B. Johnson did the Civil Rights actAct, afro americansAfro-Americans are generally still in aan economic and social disadventagedisadvantage.
Examples for this are the missing education, unemployment and poverty.
For each of these examples he gives statistics, which speak for themselves.
I think this can notcannot stay how it is and wondered if you have any experiences, towards this topic or an opinion.
